etymology.description: 戯(戲) (xì, 'play') is a variant form of 麾(麾) (huī), originally associated with military signals or overseeing a performance -> used later to mean 'play' or 'drama'.
etymology.interpretation: The character 戲(xì, 'play') evolved as a variant form of 麾(麾), which typically related to commanding or directing. Over time, its meaning expanded to encompass the idea of 'play' or theatrical performance, reflecting an evolution from a military context to entertainment.

examples.chinese: 父母鼓励他演戲(父母鼓勵他演戲)。
examples.english: His parents encourage him to act in plays.

examples.chinese: 明天我们去看戲(明天我們去看戲)，体验传统文化(體驗傳統文化)。
examples.pinyin: Míngtiān wǒmen qù kàn xì, tǐyàn chuántǒng wénhuà.
examples.english: Tomorrow we will go watch a play and experience traditional culture.

examples.chinese: 老演员总是执着于戲(老演員總是執著於戲)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo yǎnyuán zǒngshì zhízhuó yú xì.
examples.english: Veteran actors are always devoted to the play.
